page.title: 10Whitehills Harbours
page.content: The earliest fishermen in Whitehills used open boats from {The Hythie} immediately in front of their houses on {Low Shore}. The outline of the {first harbour}can still be seen to the West of the present one. Today's { {fishing harbour,}built in 1900, provides shelter for modern diesel engined pair trawlers up to 60' in length, with a{fish market}adjoining and{ship chandlers, harbour office and {gear stowage sheds opposite. There is another{small harbour}some quarter mile East of the present one. Now part of a Play Park it once served the {Tileworks at Blackpotts}, an{ {Ancient Industrial Monument}dating from the {17th. Century,}recently demolished, oddly, by the District Council to make way for a private caravan site.
